title: Problem-Based Learning and Simulation Education to Enhance Pediatric Cardiology Diagnosis and Treatment Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary cardiology and pediatric clinical knowledge
context.additional_context: Practical education centered on clinical simulation equipment and problem-based learning materials.

learning_goals: Establish differential diagnoses and treatment plans by analyzing various pediatric cardiac disease cases
Improve emergency response capabilities for pediatric cardiac conditions in clinical simulation environments

Over 2–4 weeks, learners can collaborate in multidisciplinary teams (3–5 members) in a PBL environment to develop solutions for a climate change mitigation science problem, communicate through a 10–15-minute presentation and 5–7-page report with logical structuring (3+ sections) and visual aids (2+ graphs/infographics). Evaluation includes peer assessment (20%: meeting 3+ of 5 team contribution criteria), instructor assessment (30%: scientific validity 4+/5), and output completeness (50%: meeting 6+ of 8 report checklist items).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
